steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your computer. Find and click the icon on the Start menu or in your Applications folder to open Chrome. StayFocusd is a third-party website blocker extension that's only available on Chrome. If you're using another browser like Firefox or Opera, make sure to search your browser's online extension store for a similar website blocker. Similar to Stayfocusd, you can use the BlockSite extension on Firefox and Opera .

steps.title: Go to the Chrome Web Store.
steps.content: Go to the Chrome Web Store . Type chrome.google.com/webstore into the address bar, and hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Search and find the Stayfocusd app on the Chrome Web Store.
steps.content: Search and find the Stayfocusd app on the Chrome Web Store. You can use the search bar in the upper-left corner of the page.

steps.title: Click the blue Add to Chrome button next to StayFocusd.
steps.content: Click the blue Add to Chrome button next to StayFocusd. This will allow you to install the extension to your browser.

steps.title: Click the Add extension button in the confirmation pop-up.
steps.content: Click the Add extension button in the confirmation pop-up. This will download and install the selected extension to your browser. You can now block any website. You will see a notification that says "StayFocusd has been added to Chrome" when your installation is finished. You can find the StayFocusd button next to the address bar in the upper-right corner of your browser.

steps.title: Open X in your internet browser.
steps.content: Open X in your internet browser. Type twitter.com into the address bar, and hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click the StayFocusd icon on the top-right of your browser.
steps.content: Click the StayFocusd icon on the top-right of your browser. This button looks like a blue and black clock icon next to your browser's address bar in the upper-right corner. It will open a pop-up window.

steps.title: Click Block this entire website in the pop-up.
steps.content: Click Block this entire website in the pop-up. This will not immediately block X, but add it to your blocked websites list, and give you some time on this website every day. Blocking will give you some time you can spend on this website every day. The website will be automatically blocked after the timer runs out. The blocking timer is set to 10 minutes by default. You can change it by clicking the Settings button at the bottom of the StayFocusd pop-up panel.

steps.title: Click Nuclear Option at the bottom to immediately block X.
steps.content: Click Nuclear Option at the bottom to immediately block X. This button is located next to a nuclear reactor icon in the lower-left corner of the StayFocusd pop-up. Nuclear Option will immediately block websites for however long you want.

steps.title: Select the "ONLY websites on my Blocked Sites list" option.
steps.content: Select the "ONLY websites on my Blocked Sites list" option. Make sure to select this option under "Which sites do you want to block?" in order to block X. If you have other websites on your blocked list, they will be blocked as well.

steps.title: Set the amount of time you want to block.
steps.content: Set the amount of time you want to block. Click the timer field under "For how long?" and enter how long you want to block X.

steps.title: Click the NUKE 'EM button.
steps.content: Click the NUKE 'EM button. This will instantly block X in your internet browser. Make sure to select Right now in the "Starting when?" section. Optionally, you can also select At a specific time here, and schedule a block for later.

steps.title: Click OK in the confirmation pop-up.
steps.content: Click OK in the confirmation pop-up. This will confirm your action, and start the Nuclear Option. X will be blocked in your browser for the set number of hours.

steps.title: Open your Mac's System Preferences.
steps.content: Open your Mac's System Preferences. Click the Apple icon on your menu bar in the upper-left corner of your screen, and click System Preferences on the menu.

steps.title: Click Parental Controls in System Preferences.
steps.content: Click Parental Controls in System Preferences. This button looks like a parent and a child icon in a yellow circle. You can find it near the lower-left corner.

steps.title: Select the user you want to block X for.
steps.content: Select the user you want to block X for. Find the user account you want to manage on the left menu, and click the user you want to edit. You have to be an administrator user account in order to set up parental controls. You can set up parental controls only for the user accounts other than your own user.

steps.title: Click the Enable Parental Controls button.
steps.content: Click the Enable Parental Controls button. This will allow you to change the control settings here. If you can't make changes, click the lock icon on the bottom-left of the window, and verify your user password. You can skip this step if Parental Controls are already enabled for this user.

steps.title: Click the Web tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Web tab at the top. This will open the browser restrictions and other internet settings.

steps.title: Select the Try to limit access to adult websites option.
steps.content: Select the Try to limit access to adult websites option. This option will allow you to specify which sites you want to block, and prevent all internet access to these websites from this user account.

steps.title: Click the Customize button.
steps.content: Click the Customize button. This will open a new window, and list all the websites you allow and block.

steps.title: Click the + icon below the "Never allow these websites" section.
steps.content: Click the + icon below the "Never allow these websites" section. This will add a new line to the "Never allow" list.

steps.title: Type www.twitter.com into the new line on the list.
steps.content: Type www.twitter.com into the new line on the list. This way, you can block all access to X in Safari. If you want to remove the block at any time, just select the X URL on the list here, and click the " - " button next to " + " at the bottom.

steps.title: Press ⏎ Return on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⏎ Return on your keyboard. This will save X to the block list.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save your new settings. The selected user will not be able to open X in Safari anymore.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings app. Find and tap the icon on your home screen to open Settings.

steps.title: Tap Screen Time in Settings.
steps.content: Tap Screen Time in Settings. This option is listed next to a purple hourglass icon. You can view a breakdown of how much you use each of your apps here.

steps.title: Tap App Limits.
steps.content: Tap App Limits . This option looks like an orange hourglass icon. You can limit how much you can use your apps here.

steps.title: Tap Add Limit.
steps.content: Tap Add Limit . This will open a new page titled "Choose Apps," and show you a list of all the categories you can limit.

steps.title: Select Social Networking on the Choose Apps list.
steps.content: Select Social Networking on the Choose Apps list. This option will allow you to limit how much time you can spend every day in social media apps. Note, this will group together and limit all of your social media apps like X, Instagram, and Facebook at the same time.

steps.title: Tap Next on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Next on the top-right. You'll be prompted to select a time limit next.

steps.title: Set a time limit for social media apps.
steps.content: Set a time limit for social media apps. Swipe the timer on your screen to set the maximum amount of time you want to allow for social media apps every day.

steps.title: Tap Add on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Add on the top-right. This will confirm your action, and add your app limit. X and all social media apps will be blocked after fulfilling your maximum amount of allowed screen time every day.
